intro: Heterotheca villosa var. scabra, commonly known as roughleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually covered in fine, rough hairs, giving it the common name "roughleaf." It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many familiar flowering plants.
